clinical_study.brief_title: Safety of Paracetamol as Antipyretic in Treatment of Dengue Infection in Adults

lead_sponsor.agency: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether regular dosage of paracetamol causes transaminitis (hepatitis) and evaluate its potency in the treatment of dengue infection.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with abnormal serum transaminase levels on the last day of fever
primary_outcome.description: Serum alanine transaminase and aspartate transaminase level will be measured at admission, and on every morning afterwards until the subject is discharged. The proportion of subjects with abnormal serum transaminase levels will be compared.
Mean serum transaminase level will be compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in serum transaminase levels
primary_outcome.description: The change in serum transaminase levels from baseline at admission will be compared.

secondary_outcome.description: Axillary temperature will be recorded every 4 hours until discharge or 8 days after admission, whichever comes first.
Duration from the fever onset to the last febrile temperature will be compared.
Duration from hospital admission to discharge will be compared.
Number of drug tablet used will be compared, both paracetamol/placebo and tramadol.

arm_group.description: Eligible patients will be randomised to receive Paracetamol prn for fever at maximum dosage of 500 mg PO q 4 hr (3 gm/day)
Eligible patients will be randomised to receive Placebo prn for fever at maximum dosage of 500 mg PO q 4 hr (3 gm/day)

intervention.description: Paracetamol 500 mg x 1 tablets according to patient's body weight
Placebo 500 mg x 1 tablets according to patient's body weight

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient age >18 years
- Dengue infection diagnosed by NS1 antigen, Dengue immunoglobulin M antibody, or polymerase chain reaction
- Admitted to the hospital
- Written informed consent from patient or attending relative able to and willing to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other possible cause of fever other than dengue infection
- Pregnancy
- Unable to take medication
- Aminotransferase level above 3 times upper normal limit
- Allergy to paracetamol or tramadol
- Paracetamol indicated for condition other than dengue infection
- Critically ill patient who need ICU or invasive ventilation support
- History of cirrhosis
- Unable to comunicate
